comment: First of all, this guy is one of the sweetest people I have ever met. Super kind and genuinely cares about every one of his students. But his class isn't for the weak. 6 5-question quizzes that are lockdown browser, with tests being IN PERSON. He changed his policy last semester and switched to in-person 50 question tests. Final is 100 questions.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: His class isn't bad. The only assignments are 5 question quizzes every other week, 3 tests, and the final. He's a funny guy and tries to make his lectures interesting. Attendance is mandatory with a sign in sheet. GO TO CLASS. If you haven't taken AP Psych beforehand, take your own notes with the textbook. He doesn't cover everything in class.
rating_tags: Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: weekly quizzes, lockdown browser no camera. one unexcused absence allowed, but is very understanding when excusing absences. passes around a paper to sign for attendance; if you're not there, someone can sign for you. lectures are long but he genuinely cares about the subject. all exams but the final are online. easy class, take him for an easy A.
rating_tags: Caring--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: No extra credit opportunities. The research if very simple and you should do it as early as possible. Tests are on lockdown but with no cam. Very strict deadlines and won't open quizzes unless you had an emergency. He's a little bit a of yapper but chill dude overall. I would take him again
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Classes are just lectures. Weekly quizzes with 5 questions so if you get on wrong your grade drops. He genuinely loves psychology. Tests are lockdown browser but no webcam. Not a bad professor but very boring class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Rifkin is clearly extremally intelligent and knows his stuff, he also really cares, his lectures are engaging, helpful, and I learned a lot. Tests and quizzes reflect notes and lectures and are not too difficult, 4 tests. Research experience takes 2 hours tops, Attendance is graded, VERY STRICT on deadlines but they are fair. Good guy.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I loved this class and I learned so much from it. This class is supper easy. The test and quizzes are on lockdown with no camera. You do need to go to class to get your points for showing up. You do have to do a research experience but it is online and it is supper easy to do.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: I would take this professor again. He loves teaching this class and you can tell. He really cares about you and what you need in his class. The exams and quizzes are on lockdown but the quizzes are easy and can look up most of the questions on quizlet. The exams and quizzes are multichoice only no short answer or essay questions.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Lectures can be boring and off topic but still an easy class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: All of his assignments were online nothing was ever taken for a grade in-person, besides attendance. His lectures were fun and you could tell he loves teaching the subject. Was somewhat boring, but you can have others write your name down if you do not want to show up.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Best professor. If you enjoy Psych, you will love this class. Easy class if you pay attention, quizzes/tests on lockdown with no camera (answers also on quizlet lol) He's really engaging and knows what he's talking about. Would definitely take him again if I could. PowerPoints are all online so you can pace yourself. Attendance is checked. 100/10:)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Inspirational--Caring

comment: professor dad jokes. The class is simple listen to lecture there's a small quiz every week or so and test every month or so. If you pay any bit of attention you'll pass.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: It's easy to get a B in this class. Watch out for him changing his mind about a quiz that shows up on d2l as being worth points because it's not. After not missing a class the entire semester you'd think that would help build rapport but it didn't and I finished the class with an 89, had he not gone back on his word it would've been an A.

Rifkin is a good professor. His grading is simple, with most grades coming from the weekly quizzes, 3 exams, and final exam. He's a very kind and respectful professor and is easy to reach both in and out of class. Attendance is mandatory and checked every class period. Tests/quizzes are online w/ lockdown browser. Lectures can be a bit boring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: 3 test that i believe weighed at least 40% of your grade so if you bomb one your screwed
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: The only assignments that we had in this class were the weekly quizzes and tests at the end of each unit, so try to study as much as you can for them. Also the weekly quizzes arent over what he had just previously learned, but what we were about to learn. So definitely read ahead in the textbook. He was very sweet and reminds me of Carl from Up.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: All quizzes and test are on D2L lockdown with no webcam. He post all the quizzes in the future notes before you take them so look ahead in the notes. There is a sign in sheet also.

Prof Rifkin is honestly so sweet but lectures can be boring at times.I got very sick & he was so understanding. grading is based on 3 tests, 1 final, 6 quizzes, SONA, & attendence. As long as you show up you should do well. TA's are helpful and have study sessions before tests. everyone replies to emails & groupme msgs quickly.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Rifkin makes psychology fun. He adds comedy and a lot of fun interactive portions to his lecture; the one downside is that he covers a lot of info in short amount of time, but he has the PowerPoints on D2L.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Rifkin had great lectures and his syllabus was straightforward. Attendance is 11% of your grade, so make sure you show up to class. The student assistants are very helpful and informative. A few tests and 5 minute quizzes, but no homework apart from SONA research that you have a whole semester to do.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: I took his class in-person in 2018, and to date, his class is still my favorite class Ive ever had. He is so funny and helpful. His class is usually large, but he will remember you if you walk out 5 minutes early. His class isnt hard, and of course psychology is always interesting. TAKE HIM IF YOU HAVE THE OPTION :)
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: No homework, the lectures are always recorded and posted , not too sure about attendance but  a textbook is not necessary bc its all in his power points. Lecture heavy but overall an easy class if you keep up with the work. TAs are amazing and have study ses before every test.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He lectures a lot and may talk about thing you don't even need to know, but his class is very easy as long as you go to the study sessions. Plus he's so sweet and funny! The TA's make the class easy by giving you a study guide before each test that is basically the test. Textbook is needed

Professor RIfkin was very lecture heavy. Although he lectured the whole class, he would tell some very interesting stories to keep you engaged. He does pop quizzes at the start of class for extra credit. Each pop quiz can earn you up to 25 points. He also has TA's who will go over the test and the answer before every test. Attend the study sessions
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Good ol' New Yorker, one of the nicest guys I've ever met. Always willing to work with you, as long as you reach out to him. His grading policy was pretty simple. 3 chapter tests, a final, and a handful of pop quizzes that were bonus points. If you go to the study sessions, you'll pass the tests. One of the TA's was kind of mean, though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Rifkin's class is average, but the tests are easy and the TA's give you a study guide and go over it that is LITERALLY THE TEST. there are pop quizzes that are EXTRA CREDIT and attendance is for a grade at the end of the semester (sign in sheet). 3 tests and a final are your grades. Also participation + attendance. Easy A
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: overall, he is a great professor, easy going, and clear. read the textbook, it will help you a lot. great class. i would recommend him for an easy A
rating_tags: Participation matters--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Go to the SI SESSIONS !!! The first test I got a 32 started going to the SI sessions and got an A on every test after ended the class with a B. Go to sessions and do study guides and youll get an A
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: GREAT GUY, Professor Rifkin was amazing at Intro Psych! He gave in-depth explanations of the chapters in the book. His tests are textbook heavy, so as long as you keep up and read the chapter you should pass just fine. He gives pop quizzes at the end of every chapter for extra credit but the overall dude is 10/10, plus he is always accessible 24/7!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: his rating is so :( Dr Rifkin only lectures & i slept in class everyday and did not read the textbook. there's only 3 test & the final. I got a 68 on the 1st test but then i went to the study sessions and i ended up with a 98 in the class so theres always hope. go to the study sessions!!!! the TA literally go over the test and gives the answers.
rating_tags: Respected--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: GO TO STUDY SESSIONS IF YOU WANT AN A! Pop quizzes are extra credit. Go to class or your grade will drop. He really loves what he teaches and is a good professor!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Rifkin is a decent teacher who really cares about his subject. His classes are all lecture- based with tests relating to the lectures and textbook. He offers an insane amount of extra credit so as long as you have a B by the end of the semester, you can make an A. I got B's on every single test of his and ended up with a grade over 100%.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I have no idea how you could get below a B in his class if you put in the work. His tests WERE difficult and his lectures had little to do with them. But there was a ridiculous amount of extra credit. I literally almost failed every test and still ended with an A because of all of the freebies. GO to the study sessions with the TA and do all E.C.!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: He is the sweetest person. He really knows the information he has to teach which makes it better. Only down fall is that when it comes to grades he is difficult. I ended up with a 79.5% in the class and he wouldnt round up to a B, but I guess thats policy. You get one absence free and then it starts counting off after that.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: If you take his class, just show up and don't pay attention. Study sessions are provided and that is the only real way to pass the tests. His lectures have nothing to do with the tests, and on top of that, there are only three tests before the final. That's a lot of work and material per test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: So Psych in general is difficult but having this sweet man as my professor made it worth it. I would say the best study method is to make flashcards and run through them on the days leading up to the test.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Before I start: this fall semester's TA was a godsend and our study sessions were very helpful! This doesn't happen every semester. The professor himself is interesting and nice, but not much of a teacher. His lectures have nothing to do with the tests so read the textbook. TONS of extra credit, 3 tests, cumulative final, mandatory attendance.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Bottom Line: Go to the study sessions and listen to the lectures and you'll pass with a 100. EVERYTHING on the test and (bonus) quizzes is on there. The study sessions go over the actual test before you take it. Lectures are fun to listen to and he has a great voice. This class actually inspired me to become a Psychology Major.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: His lectures aren't great, so you have to do a lot of your own studying from the book BUT I did not get an A on any of the tests (low B's and C's) and I still got an A in the class. His pop quizzes go toward extra credit plus attendance and participation (just saying a few things here and there) are an easy 100 points each.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Gives study sessions for each test that are SUPER helpful. Beware of the final, overall a good professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Definetly a spunky guy, but his lectures are boring and filled with fluff/jargon. Going to the TA study sessions and having a group chat kept my A in the class. Over i'd look for better but theres nothing horrible about him (just dull content)
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is an awesome professor. He has a lot of real life stories and experience that really help make his lectures make sense. You definitely have to read the book to do good on the test, but as long as they aren't too hard. He gives pop quizzes but they are all for extra credit. Very glad I took him and didn't go off most of the reviews of him.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's a really cool guy lecturing about intro psych. He is obviously very passionate about what he is talking about. Will answer questions about anything during a lecture. His class is all lecture, and sometimes doesn't really apply to what you're tested on, but if you go to the study session with the TA you'll pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: prof rifkin is a very spunky guy. i thoroughly enjoyed lectures but his tests were difficult and did not reflect the lectures. i would suggest studying the textbook and going to study sessions with the TA if there is one. its not a difficult course but definitely wasn't an easy A. if you put in the work and show up to class you should be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Rifkin is a pretty good professor, but it's hard to pay attention in his class. He knows the material, but his lectures are so long that it's easy to zone out. Also, his exams are pretty hard. You can read the book & take notes on his powerpoints and still not know the answers to the questions on the exam. The best you CAN do is to make sure you read and know the material well enough to be able to make good guesses or use process of elimination on the exams.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Rifkin is an amazing teacher. He is very interested in the subject he teaches which makes the class worthwhile. You will have to read the book if you want to pass the class. You cant get good grades if you don't try. He started to give us pop quizzes which he added toward our final grade. He is really funny and sarcastic and is super helpful.
He clearly knows the material but it is just hard to prepare for his test. He is a very nice guy but the tests are too hard since we can't really prepare for it.

Professor Rifkin is a very sweet and adorable man, however, the information he lectures about in class will not get you a good grade. Had to read and take notes out of the book in order to pass. He's also pretty boring and "so on" are his favorite words. The tests are specific to the book also.

Professor Rifkin is so adorable, but his lectures are not very specific.  You pretty much have to teach yourself by reading the book. He had a T.A. in my class and she was extremely helpful. If it wasn't for her I don't think I could have done well in his class. I do not recommend taking him if you are not willing to work.

Lectures are very long. Tests are over the book not what's talked about in class. The tests do go by chapter so that is a plus. The class drags on but he is a nice guy. Psyc is hard to get into unless it is something you love.

He's the sweetest but his lectures are impossible to pay attention to. Practically read the textbook everyday. That's the only way you'll pass. He'll give bonus points at the end of the semester.  The test are so hard.

There's 4 tests, last one being worth the most, and they're 50 questions each (last one is 60) on scantrons. Made an F, D, and 2 C's and came out with a high B for my average. Gives a lot of extra credit and attendance is worth 20%. It's kind of hard to fail his class if you just go to study sessions and do the extra credit and show up.

Took psych thinking it would be interesting and an easy class, well this wasnt, very boring lectures over random stories of ppl he had as patients and very ambiguous of what you should know for the test
Doesn't go over anything of importance in class, random lectures, unspecific what we should know for tests

He is super confusing and ambiguous. He says to "read the book and study the power points" but his power points just have random names, events, vocabulary. There's no explanation or assistance when studying. Everyone in the class was failing so he started making the tests open book. That just proved to me that he knew he wasn't teaching well.

AVOID THIS CLASS. I thought psych would be very interesting but I was sorely mistaken. VERY BORING AND ALSO IMPOSSIBLE TESTS. You literally have to memorize the book, and even then, the test questions will still be difficult. IT SUCKS. I WOULD DREAD THIS CLASS EVERY WEEK. Had to leave early often because I couldn't stand it.
Awful! Do not take his class!

lesHe is one of the hardest teachers EVER ! He is so nice, but he never uses his information he teaches in class, i've failed both his test so far, and doubt i'll pass this class!! I read the textbook and did the test questions in the back, but still the test are nothing like we discuss in class.

Unless you are already really good at psyc, I would not take him! His lectures are very boring and he doesn't give very much extra credit. Attendance is mandatory, and class is miserable. I have studied very hard for every test so far and I've failed both of them. Only three tests- doesn't drop any of them. and a final. oh, but he is nice.

Rifkin is by far the hardest teacher I have ever taken. Do not take him. For an introductory course there is far too much detail. He can't teach. A good bit of everything is from the book. He is nice but his tests are complex and near impossible to pass.I thought the reviews on here weren't so bad, but if it weren't for the HUGE end of year curve..

Awesome class if psych is your major. The only real downfall is that he doesn't return tests, so you don't really know what you need to work on. He gives the opportunity to meet and go over tests, but for commuter students or adult learners with jobs or families, this is not ideal. Great overall.
Nice guy, cant teach. Unless you memorize the 40 pg chapters you wont do well.

Exams are mc but pretty long. No study guides. Ext Cr opportunities even though he says there won't be. Can be a very boring lecturer but he breaks it up with a youtube vid occasionally. Attendance counts for pts and is required by board or regents. Class was pretty easy but I was a Sr taking it to circumvent fin aid bs. Brought Sudoku everyday:/
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. He does not give study guides and all he does is lecture. The only guidance he gives is to read all chapters and powerpoints. Impossible to pass

Nice guy that loves psychology, but he CANNOT teach! I DO NOT RECOMMEND HIM! His tests are hard and he does not give any type of guidelines as to what is going to be on the test. Everything is fair game. He does give extra credit though if you do extra studies. You have to attend class. If you miss 3 or more classes he takes off points. Can't teach

DO NOT take this class. His tests are so hard. Everything is fair game (power points, book, notes). The lectures are very boring. He doesn't have a study guide for his tests and he doesn't review what will be on them.

Do NOT take his class! It is impossible to pass his tests. He does not give study guides. His only "advice" is to read all power points in Vista, read all chapters in the book, and take the practice tests. I did ALL THIS and did not pass. However I have 2 A's and 1 B in my other classes. All he does is lecture. You won't learn ANYTHING. TRUST ME

He lectures everyday.Really boring and did not teach well.Made A's in all my classes but his.My class did not have one open book test.Everything is fair game on the test(book,powerpoints, notes).You have 3 tests,a midterm, and a final. Each test is 150 point test with 50 Q's and the final is 300 pts with 100 Q's. Test are not that easy.

Nice guy that loves the course. Grade is comprised of 2 presentations and 2 tests. Presentations are based on the topics in book and done in groups, one pro and one con. His grading is a little weird since no one in my class got a 100 on either presentation. Reading the book is a must if you want to pass the tests. Tests are not cumulative

Nice man. 1st test hard. Lots of material. other tests open book/you have to be able to look the stuff up in a timely fashion to finish the tests in time.Take notes on power points that helps in class. I took this class w/ another Prof made a D so I retook. Final is 100 questions you have 2 hours to finish. Take this guy if you need Psych 1101

Really nice guy! The students present the topics, so he basically does not teach. 2 presentations, but they are super easy. The tests are ONLY on the info from the book, so if you want to get a good grade, read the book. Really chill class, but hard tests.

He's a nice guy but his class is all lectures and very boring. The last two tests were open book and I got 2 A's. Honestly I can't say I really learned anything though because the tests were open book so I put no effort into studying. A lot of extra credit opportunties, I made about 150 extra points! He goes up to 1000, so that was also helpful.

If u dont like speaking in front of the class, dont take this class. 2 presentations but getting an A on them is easy. Tests are somewhat difficult. The tests are solely based on the book so read it carefully! Strict attendance policy but it's a 10 week class so it's over fast. I missed 4 days total and still made a B. Fairly easy class.

Very nice guy! The course is mostly taught through panel presentations done by the students. You're responsible for doing two of these for 100pts total. There is a midterm and a non-cumulative final, 100pts each, on the issues you go over. There is also a 100pt position paper and 100pts for attendance/participation. 10 week course. Read the book!

He is pretty weird but he gave us open book tests which was AMAZING!! Without open book tests it's a really hard class. He posts his power points on vista. I would take notes from the posted powerpoints and ignore him and I got a B+. Attendance is mandatory he makes you sign in but you can leave right after that.

He's a really nice guy, but he's really boring. He sometimes discussed case studies, which were interesting, but other than that it was pretty much reading off the powerpoints. He takes attendance, but its easy enough to sign the roster and leave. Read book, review the powerpoint, and it's an easy A.
He is a very sweet man, but goes off into his own world alot. I enjoyed the class though.

Answers questions, but repeats himself & is unclear. Uses powerpoints in class lectures & posts them online, but not very helpful. I've found reading the textbook to be the best way to learn. Tests are 50 mult. choice questions. Loves the word "sexual". If discussing sexual stuff every day in class is offensive, choose another teacher. I wish I had

Only take this class if you can learn on your own. His tests should be fairly easy if you read the material that goes along with his powerpoints. He's a nice guy, but his teaching can get really dull. I found most of the students logging onto facebook or taking naps during his lectures.
doesnt really care about attendence
The class was interesting, but we literally taught ourselves. The entire semester was composed of "panels" over each chapter. He did not teach at all.

He lectures first two classes after that students teach each issue debate style. You have two debates, a midterm, paper, and final. Class ends 2/3 through semester. He's vague about what's on tests and about paper. For tests go to books website and do the study questions. Almost every Q there is on the test. STUDY!
He is a sweetheart but he has no idea of how to teach. He talks more about himself than the actual subject.

He was a nice guy. Kind of like a grandpa... My grandmother died and he was totally sympathetic and understanding about the classes missed for the funeral. He is not real hard to get an A with and i enjoyed the discussions even though they didn't always stay on topic. Funny and considerate. I would recommend him. The class was interesting!
No Comments

TERRIBLE!! Did not learn anything. 3 test that are not based on the book but solely based on his biased opinion. 2 mandatory debates that never stay on the right topic; he never gives a grade for this. One paper with no clarity on what to do. No one I talked to got higher than a B on this paper. Takes attendance. Nice guy, bad teacher.
